Reviews.Title: “Great value and suitably chic”
Reviews.Author: macks
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just 60 seconds walk from Tirso de Molina Metro on Line 1 and a couple of minutes from Plaza Mayor and Sol. The hotel is a pleasant surprise with basic, clean and cool rooms. The shower was one of the best hotel showers I've ever experienced, decent pressure and funky LED lights in the cubicle. The blinds can be drawn to hide the shower from the bedroom if you want. The beds were comfy, and the room decently air conditioned. Breakfast is included in the room rate - nothing fancy, just help yourself to cereal, toast, coffee and juice. Coffee, tea and juice is available all day in the kitchen area. Great hotel, great service and near enough perfect location for a tourist in Madrid - definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A chic and basic stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Qarolina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a strategical street, a five minute walk from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. The rooms are small but clean and give an overall pleasent feeling. You will enjoy the bathroom with its fancy chromoterapic shower, even if unfortunately the bidet is not present. If your neighbours are noisy you will probabily have some trouble sleeping, anyway that's the only flaw in an otherwise comfortable room. Breakfast is composed by a cold buffet - not bad- and tea and coffe machine are available for use all day long. This turned out to be a very big plus, for us. The staff is kind and helpful. We strongly recommend this hotel for a nice staying in the centre of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlliMac12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what it claims to be - chic and basic. Very modern decor, but clean, comfortable rooms with nice bathrooms. Also - breakfast was included with the room which was a first amongst the 5 different hotels/cities we'd already been to in Spain! Finally, there was a stocked pantry with food, fruit and drinks that accessible to guests at all times. Definitely a great value in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: rkgill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance from literally everything! Rooms are chic and modern, shower was decent (though it tended to leak water into the room). Rooms are European size (i.e. small), but bed was very comfortable so we always got a decent night's sleep. The food bar was awesome, great coffee and fresh fruits etc. Free wifi in the lobby. All in all great value.

Reviews.Title: “Was excellent till.....”
Reviews.Author: kyzza01
Reviews.Content: Sadly the actions of the owner/manager has led me to give this hotel a rating of terrible. Up until that point we were very happy with the hotel. It's a 5 min drive from Atocha Station. The female staff member at reception was extremely helpful. They have a very chic & modern comfortable beds, I like the balcony - you can open it and look out onto the street and people watch. They have complimentary continental breakfast with cereals, breads etc. They have a funky shower with different coloured lighting, only has a curtain to the door from the shower to bedroom (where a wall should be) so if you're not comfortable with the person you're staying with and maybe peeking through the curtain, maybe get seperate rooms. The room is big and open, the tv has hepas of channels, only 1 in English. We had a terrace on our floor level with only 2 other rooms. Wifi access - which was strong the whole time. They have a laptop you can use downstairs and air con, but be careful because it turns off after a certain time so you can wake in the middle of the night to a hot room. As I said our floor level only had 2 other rooms, we could the room next to us get busy at midnight doing their thing, woke us up and the bed was moving, it virtually sounded like someone was moving house. We had a terrace on the floor that was not used by anyone we saw, we were there for four days and decided to wash our socks (we've been travelling for 4 weeks up till then) we washed 6 pairs of socks and put them behind the lounge chair on the terrace, absolutely no one would have seen them. Of course in the morning we woke to find our socks were gone, we asked the cleaners where they were and they said they were down with management. Well the manager then began to explain that the hotel wasn't a hostel and that you can't leave clothes out in the open. I'm sorry but these were socks, not undergarments or clothes or shoes, and no one, even if you wanted to use the lounge chair would have seen them. We put them there at night time & went to pick them up in the morning! Okay, what would you have us do, put them in the room to drip all over cables? He said they have a dryer and next time ask to use that instead of putting them outside. Again, because this is a no frills hotel, they have no information anywhere about the hotel or the "free use" of the dryer. So for his attitude and actions towards something so trivial has given the hotel a rating of terrible. Pity.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, basic, helpful staff and loved the all-day coffee/cappuccino machine!”
Reviews.Author: KatieCanada
Reviews.Content: Chic and Basic Mayerling is a perfect base for a holiday in Madrid if you want to be walking distance to the major sights, but not next to some of the crazy nightclub/bars that would keep you awake. It's really chic and basic. There's no fancy toiletries (soap and body wash only) or upscale linens, but if you just need a place to stay with free breakfast, free wifi and helpful staff, this is a great place. The bed and towels are basic. The toilets are a little difficult to flush. Rooms have a tiny balcony. The shower stall has funky lighting (no tub) and has a see through window into the sleeping area, so make sure you're comfortable with that! Breakfast area rocks. Loved the coffee/cappuccino machine. There's a variety of fruits, bread, croissants and chocolate mini muffins to start your day. Milk, yogurt and juice are also available. The front desk staff are by helpful for translating websites, providing directions, and restaurant suggestions for the city. It's great value at around 105 euros a night with a prepaid reservation. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emmdeeToronto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stat at the Chic & Basic Mayerling. The location was fantastic - we walked to every single site we saw during our stay in Madrid (and believe me, we saw a lot of sites!). Our room was clean, fresh, and as others have mentioned, without any frills. In fact, it is quite bare bones. But for the time we actually spent in the hotel room, it was exactly what we needed. The flooring and finishes had an industrial feel to them, and won't suit everyone, but we didn't mind that at all. We did notice some noise from the hallway, but it was minimal (there are only a few rooms on each floor, so there's not a lot of traffic in each hallway). We didn't notice any noise between rooms. We loved the coloured LED lights, and the glassed-in shower that you can see from the bed - gives the room some edge! We also had a Juliette balcony overlooking the street, which allowed us lots of fresh air in the room. The free breakfast was a definite bonus, and it provided just the variety we needed. Lots of breads, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, granola, juice, etc. The coffee maker makes specialty drinks, and the nice thing is, that is available for use throughout the day too (not just at breakfast), as are juices, fresh fruit, and bottled water. We also were happy to have free wireless internet. Staff were helpful, and the stay was a great one. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and liked free water”
Reviews.Author: TheFrasiers
Reviews.Content: The location was great but the room was just ok. We enjoyed having a balcony, but never thought that the floor in our room or bathroom was very clean. The white walls felt a little sterile. The bed was very hard. The shower was nice although it was small. All in all, the hotel was not our style especially after stay in a very nice hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, for a short stay what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: engalgado
Reviews.Content: Fed up with concrete box hotels, we thought we'd check this one out, having read that it was a converted textile warehouse. It's to be found in the rag trade district between Sol and the Plaza Tirso de Molina, an excellent location for visiting the cultural, culinary and shopping attractions of central Madrid. The style of the hotel is black and white functionality. Clean, simple and welcoming. Very helpful recepion staff. We stayed three nights. Our room was on the third floor and looked out onto the Conde de Romanones street. We had no problems sleeping - no noise! We loved the kitchen area downstairs - serve yourself at breakfast, and grab a tea, coffee or bottle of water any time you like. One last comment - in all the streets around you may see lots of graffitti. Don't be put off by this. We felt quite safe at all times - the police seem to have got these hooligans under control.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, noisy”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean rooms. Prepare for a lot of even street noise, especially on the weekend. Liked the free loose leaf tea. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel for a two night stay in order to see Madrid in our travels while in Spain. We stayed Jan 7-9, 2012, during the down season, so there were many hotels available to choose from. After reading Trip Advisor, I am sure glad we chose this hotel. First, upon check in, William was fantastic. We were early, he stored our bags, and then gave us DETAILED information on a map of what to see first, where to eat certain types of food, and what to do in the next two days. He was excellent. Throughout the stay when we would ask questions, the front desk was more than happy to help. Next, with a 55 euro hotel called "Chic and Basic" I sort of expected IKEA and lack-luster. While we were right about the extensive IKEA appointments, the linens were clean and comfortable, the water was hot and fast, and the room was exactly like the pictures portrayed (even the disco shower!). Finally, the location is everything that other travelers have mentioned. While Madrid seems to be a walking town, we were within seconds of the metro stop that brought us from the AVE high speed train (THIS IS A BIG, HUGE, PLUS for railway AVE passengers!!!). In addition, we were in 10 minutes walking from shopping, bars, and cultural sights. Definitely worth the price of paying for a cab from a further hotel. There is a "help yourself" area with simple teas, coffees, waters, and small eats (continental breakfast by some American standards). This was excellent upon returning from being out all day, or for a kick-off in the morning before venturing out. The hotel only seems to have about 20 or so rooms, so this area was NEVER over-ridden with other guests, and usually quite empty. Finally, the hotel has Wi-Fi which seems to be hit and miss on speeds at certain times, but I was able to use my iPhone at times when the computer and the Wi-Fi didn't seem to get along. Hopefully the hotel maintains the property for the next guests. I highly recommend this for a simple two night stay with a friend or partner. Great job William--color coated our map, fun to chat with, and helped us with places to avoid (tourist traps), and helped us with other Spanish areas.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: dianamorais
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The hotel is clean and modern, beautifully designed. Fair price. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie S
Reviews.Content: The name says it all, this hotel is very new and minimal. It has everything you need, and none of the frills. The rooms are very clean and stylish. The public areas are comfortable with interesting decoration. There is a communal kitchen area where you can grab a bottle of water and eat the provided breakfast. The location is amazing, especially considering the price. It is right outside of Sol near La Latina which is a great area for tapas and nightlife. So nice to be able to walk a few blocks to get "home" after dinner or a night out! We were always able to find great restaurants and cafes nearby. You can easily walk to many of the major sites, and it is very easy to get around using public transportation from here as well. I lived in Madrid a few years ago and I knew parts of this neighborhood can have the reputation of being a little rough, but the hotel is located in the touristy part and I felt totally comfortable walking around at night, etc. They lock the door after midnight so you have to get "buzzed" in by the front desk (it is staffed 24 hours) so that also made us feel very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very clever idea”
Reviews.Author: Sasha199
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes you re-think what you want in a hotel. When we first opened the door to our room my heart sank at the cold austerity: a black vinyl floor, beds and a hard white plastic chair. Not exactly inviting and cozy. Once we got settled in, however, the genius of the hotel took hold. We had just had a long train journey and wanted a cup of coffee...the downstairs free snack area was just perfect and we enjoyed real espresso, fruit and yoghurt in a little outdoor courtyard. Then we wanted a shower...the best shower I have had in a long time. The water pressure was massive, and the changing colour of the lights inside the shower was strangely relaxing. To finish off there was a real hairdryer (not one of those wall mounted ones that only waft tepid air). After dinner in the lovely neighbourhood we snuggled into our very comfortable duvet covered beds and were able to read with the really bright fibreoptic bedside lights. The next morning the free breakfast downstairs was extensive with toast, cheese, ham, fruit and pastries. By the end of our stay we had forgotten the initial chilly impression. It really did anticipate and meet all of the essential needs of a traveller. Probably better for a short stay than a long one. The lack of homey ambience would get to one after a while. We stayed in an XL room which was configured as a triple. It consisted of a double and a good sized single bed. It is a good idea to indicate you want a triple when you book so they can add the third bed.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: Klinkered
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to all tourist attractions, shopping areas and to public transport. Rooms are basic, but modern and definitely value for money. Great shower and more than average matrasses. WIFI available in room and breakfast area! Takes about 20 min by taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Really chic!”
Reviews.Author: marutatsu
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel, convenient location close to Placa Mayor and the metro, the staff is really helpful (english speaking), the rooms are basic but very nice and clean! Really useful the "Enjoy yourself area" with coffee, juices and fruit available all day and night! I'll suggest it to everyone for a beautiful stay in Madrid :)

Reviews.Title: “More basic than chic”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flashpacker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and very affordable. The staff was great: very helpful and friendly. The room has very basic facilities. There is extremely limited storage for clothes and nowhere to place bags; we have to sort through bags on the floor. I also didn't like the shower setup/screen--perhaps a bit too chic for me.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, basic and very good!”
Reviews.Author: Thaïs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Chic and Basic Mayerling is very well located, a short walk to Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. You can walk to a lot of points of interest without a great deal of trouble (Prado Museum, Gran Via, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor, Plaza Oriente, Palacio Real, etc.) . I chose it based in its location, price and I cannot lie that breakfast is a very important feature for me. Chic and Basic Mayerling was my choice because it had it all and free internet too! I made my reservation by the internet and have no problem concerning it. I followed the hotel tip to go from Barajas aiport to the hotel via metro. A trip costs two euros and involves three stations...no big deal if you arrive at a decent time of the day, I guess. The only thing is that if you have a lot or heavy luggages I wouldn't recomend it as there are obstacles (along the way you will find stairs and you will have to carry your luggage!). The trip to the station Tirso de Molina from the airport took me around fifty minutes and was easy. When you arrive at this station you won't be far from the hotel...easy, very easy. I am not really good with distances, but you won't take more then five minutes to reach the hotel. The station is in front of the Calle Conde de Romanones! The staff at the hotel couldn't be more attentive and nice. Althought the hotel does not make reservations for you (for excursions or tours) they will assist you to find out what and how to do it. The help yourself area is a plus. There at breakfast time you can find: yogurt, water, juice, fruits, milk, a machine with coffe, coffe and milk and cappucino, croissants and cupcakes, jam, butter, cheese and ham. More than enough for you to start a new day. At other times of the day you will find water, yogurt, coffe. Very nice. The room I stayed in was nice (large twin), well mantained and chic. There are separated areas for the toilet bowl, sink and shower....and what a shower! Very powerful! I found it spacious. There is one disadvantage: there is no place to put your luggage other then on the floor. Although this is a disadvantage, I sure wouldn't give up on staying at the hotel because of it.

Reviews.Title: “The big chains could learn a thing or two from this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erki92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic find right in the centre of Madrid. Not only does it have a great location, the reception staff couldn't be more helpful,the rooms are big and bright, the beds are comfy and there is free wi-fi, breakfast, drinks and fruit. Plaza Mayor is only a few minutes walk away, as is the Tirso de Molina metro stop, the easiest way into the cty from the airport. Despite being very much in the centre, Chic&Basic is on a quiet street so you are guaranteed a good sleep. Having stayed in hotels in this price bracket all over Europe, I can't praise Chic&Basic enough - it's the best I've stayed in by far!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Chic and basic and cheerful too!”
Reviews.Author: StarrOxford
Reviews.Content: What a fab little budget hotel. Really quirky and thoughtful and in a great location. The staff are incredibly laid back and helpful. The public areas are appealing and witty with a laptop for customer use. Breakfast in in these areas, we didn’t encounter the rush that is described in some reviews but could see it might get crowded. The great plus is the fridge of free soft drinks so that you could take water up to your room. In fact, there are lots and lots of thoughtful and funny details like the large free shower gel labelled - the best free shower gel you will ever steal from a hotel room! The room is clean and modern, with really appealing décor. It is as spacious as some hotels at twice the price with a fab shower. The complaints about the glass wall to the bathroom are a bit silly because there is a curtain that pulls across the whole wall. It makes the room look bigger though. There was a bit of lack of storage so the cases looked a bit untidy. A simple shelf could have made all the difference to this. There was also only one bedside light, but that is pretty common in many hotels. We really really like this hotel. We like more luxury sometimes, but this really hits the mark as a place that offers ‘cheap and basic’ - it does what it says on the tin. It is also in a great area and you can walk to all the sights and eating places really quickly - it’s in the heart of things but on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic for sure but plenty comfortable and a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: gidgetgoestoeurope
Reviews.Content: More basic than chic but this was a fine hotel for seeing the Madrid sights. Great location within walking distance of nearly everything you want to see in Madrid. Also very convient to the metro making the trip to and from the train station and airport super easy. Far and away the best aspect of this hotel is the friendly and informed staff. They gave us great information about Madrid as well as many excellent suggestions about other places to visit in Spain. An added bonus is the coffee machine and fridge with some light snacks and drinks in the lobby available to guests 24 hours a day. The rooms are small and without frills but the hotel is clean, safe and very welcoming and makes a great place to explore Madrid from.

Reviews.Title: “A better version of a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Godfather-of-Soul
Reviews.Content: I would echo the positive reviews for this hotel; it really is Chic&Basic and in a great location for touring Madrid. New, clean and modern in the Ikea way. For us, the choices made to keep it inexpensive were good: no tub, but a roomy shower (the darken glass wall a Euro touch), no carpet, but a shiny clean floor, no restaurant, but step outside. The room was surprising large and the staff were very nice. Free high speed internet. A very positive experience and unmatched for the price. I will seek out the brand in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MEB3494
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests the rooms are very basic: small, clean and simple. The staff was excellent, very welcoming, helpful with directions and spoke fluent English. The best part of the hotel was the location, we couldn’t believe that all the major sites were within walking distance, no need for cabs or the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but not chic and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: GioTbilisi
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good location. Only a few minutes walk to Puerta del Sol. Design is very basic. For my taste a bit too basic. The breakfast buffet is quite limited as well. I guess it is okay if you are staying for a day or two, but people who are staying longer should find a real hotel and for the price of this hotel, one can find a decent hotel in Madrid. It is definitely not cheap! On the good side are the location and high speed internet!

Reviews.Title: “Basic But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: qwertycw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in May of 2010 when we first arrived in Spain. The hotel is "no frills" basic - No carpeting in room, no dresser, sink in the room instead of a separate bathroom - but is yet very comfortable and welcoming. Wi-Fi and blow dryer in the room. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast area in the lobby is open 24 hours with free coffee, water or juice and the location and price were great. It's in the City so you should expect some minimal noise but I couldn't find a better deal for the price so close to Sol and Mayor (5 minute walk). I would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone who doesn't mind trading some amenities for Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern budget option”
Reviews.Author: smiling_everywhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the Chic and Basic Mayerling, and it is true to its name. Chic--new, modern, good shower (though not for the shy), cheekily-named hotel amenities, funny murals in the hallways. Basic--at least in the room we stayed in, not much in the way of decor. Room was large, bed was fine, but i don't remember even having one picture on the walls. it was minimalist to be sure, but didn't always feel minimalist-chic, sometimes more minimalist-cheap. (This feeling was reinforced by the flimsiness of the wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room--kind of like when you put up a temporary wall. But then we had the last available room in the place, so probably not representative of what the best rooms are like. A key thing to know is that the shower is separated from the bedroom only by its clear glass wall. So this would not be a great feature if you are traveling with someone and want to maintain some mystery/modesty. that said, the shower itself was a good one, with nice pressure and an overhead rain-style. i especially liked the free all-hours access to espresso, juice, fruit, etc downstairs in the common area. and the location was great, easy walking distance to La Latina and elsewhere, but on a street that didn't feel touristy. This place was a great value, and I would recommend it, especially for younger (<35 or so) travelers. it seems aimed to a post-hostel, pre-grand-hotel type of crowd and definitely has enough good features that I would come back. Though next time would book earlier so I wouldn't be left with the last room in the place.

Reviews.Title: “great value and service”
Reviews.Author: birdyba
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights at the Mayerling C&B. Great value for money! The hotel is small but nicely decorated and very well located. Tow blocks from Sol, three from Plaza Mayor, in short great to get anywhere walking or by metro. The rooms are neat, beds very confortable, large window and flatscreen. The bathroom is as other guests pointed out separated from the room by a glass wall. But there is a full size courtain you can draw while the other person is in the bathroom, no problem. There is a 24hour coffee, tea and beverage bar at the lobby where breakfast is also served. Finally, and one of the best things of this hotel, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Gave me great tips and helped me with my travel arragements. A definite find.

Reviews.Title: “Super Style & Function”
Reviews.Author: Karlito81
Reviews.Content: just spent a week at this hotel and I cant stress enough how much I loved staying there... the whole ambience was exactly as it says on the cover ... chic & (not so) basic. This brand new hotel had everything I could need... minus all the extra frills found in some other hotels ... which I never use anyway. Location is very good also...a 1 min walk from Metro Line 1. Really enjoyed the breakfast arrangement ... made it feel so homely. The shower lights were brilliant ! :)

Reviews.Title: “It is chic, and much more than basic.”
Reviews.Author: orangeroof
Reviews.Content: The location is good. Five minutes to the main plazas, and a metro stop is right down the street. The hotel is new, and well done. As with other chic&basic's, it has a table/seating area in the lobby. This one only serves breakfast from 7 - 11 AM. After that, the food is removed, and only juices, yogurt, coffee and fruit are available 24 hours. Breakfast is croissants, toast, ham & cheese. The staff was friendly and helpful, and spoke English. There is not a computer available for guest use, and I'm not sure about Wi-Fi. Our room was large, with a balcony facing the street. The interior design was very cool. The shower has a clear glass wall facing the room, with a blind you can close for the more modest. You can set the shower lights to change color while you bathe. The large sink had good lighting, and there was ample storage areas. The toilet was in it's own closet. The bed was comfortable, and the room fairly quiet. The hotel seems to be geared to adults. Wouldn't recommend it for children under the age of 12. It was a very chic place, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value modern hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: gourmandetraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (midnight) and the hotel was easy to get to by the subway from the airport (30 mins) and only 2 minutes walk from Tirso de Molina. Its on a small side street 5 mins walk from the bustling plaza santa ana and 10 mins walk from the plaza mayor, so its a great base from which to explore the city. Its all in the title - its chic and its basic - in a tasteful minimalist way. the hotel seems quite new, the finish was very nice and the whole place was clean and bright. i would describe it as a value boutique hotel. the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. i booked a Large room which was not really large but was certainly big enough for the 2 of us. i peeked in at an XL room and it wasn't massively bigger but might be nice to have the extra couple of square metres space. the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was compact and functional with a fantastic power shower (oh, and fun coloured led lights you can play with!) the room itself had a comfortable double bed, flat screen tv (all spanish channels) a small area to hang clothes, small bedside cabinets. one side of the room was a floor to ceiling glass window which didn't open and looked out onto a wall. the room had effective air con which could be controlled from a panel in the room. it was certainly big and comfortable enough for a place to crash. on the ground floor there was a help yourself area with a free supply of soft drinks which was a nice little extra. there is a roof terrace which my husband said was great. the hotel staff were happy to look after our bags on the last day after we checked out. i would be happy to return to this hotel or to recommend it to friends in their 20s and 30s (i think this is the age group its aimed at).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: BSURiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new (launched in july 2009) and the staff - especially the manager - are always available to help. They accommodated our luggage during the check in and check out and helped us to define a 2 days tour around Madrid. The hotel is located in the heart of Madrid, really close to Plaza Mayor and La Latina (an area full of tapas bars and restaurants). Chic and Basic Mayerling is a great option in Madrid considering its location, helpful staff and quality of services.

HotelInfo.Name: Chic&Basic Mayerling
HotelInfo.Address: C/ del Conde de Romanones 6, 28012 Madrid, Spain
